alert.note: Alert for Central St. Louis; Koochiching; North Itasca; North St. Louis; South Itasca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 01 at 8:05PM CST until December 03 at 4:00AM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON FRIDAY TO 4 AM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of one to three inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph causing visibility of a half mile or less later in the afternoon into the evening. * WHERE...Koochiching, North St. Louis, North Itasca, Central St. Louis and South Itasca Counties. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Bois Forte Band, Deer Creek, Lake Vermilion and, Nett Lake areas. * WHEN...From noon Friday to 4 AM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A period of freezing rain is possible Friday afternoon before the precipitation switches to all snow and colder air moves in after frontal passage. Low visibility is possible from mid-afternoon Friday into Friday evening.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.

area.areaDesc: Central St. Louis; Koochiching; North Itasca; North St. Louis; South Itasca
